title: (x) Illums Bolighus logo - Berling {Goran Soderstrom}
content:
Does anyone know what the ’Illums Bolighus’ face is?

Cheers

Si

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [illums\_bolighus.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014513/http:/typophile.com/files/illums_bolighus.gif) | 2.18 KB |

 [‹ nova magazine logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014513/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20199 "Go to previous forum topic") [Chalet font - anything the same or very similar? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014513/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20214 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Duckworth

comments.content:
P.S. Found a larger image...

Si

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014513im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/illums-large_4110.jpg)
I’d say it’s some sort of garamond… none of mine matched exactly.

Could it be Berling Bold, from our swedish Karl-Erik Forsberg?

The only letter that speak against this is the “o”…

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/berling/ef-bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014513/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/berling/ef-bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/berling/ef-bold/")

Or?

Yes, it must be…

They have manipulated the “o” a little bit only.

Be sure to check out this aswell:  
 [http://www.berlingnova.se/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014513/http:/www.berlingnova.se/ "http://www.berlingnova.se/")

Kind regards from a proud Swede ;-)

Thanks, Guys!

I think Berling Bold is it. Thanks for the link Goran!

Si
